subject: Title Change
event:
The episode I scripted for the third season of HBO's GAME OF THRONES has been retitled.

It was formerly "Autumn Storms," which I never much liked... but the episode did have a lot of rain in it.

The rain went away.  So did the title.

The episode is now "Chains."  I like that better.  And it works on both a literal and metaphorical level.

It will still be the seventh show of the season, episode 307.

comments.article:
Awesome! The next season is definitely a reason I'm looking forward to 2013! (Yes, the next book too, but I wouldn't mention that. Also, I wouldn't connect "2013" to that intentionally either...)

So. Yay! :)
Glad it's something you like better!  :)
"Autumn Storms" sounds like a porn star name.
Chains, huh?  Who will be in chains at this point?  Karstarks?  Brienne?  Jaime still?  Tyrion?  You don't have to answer.  I'm just idly speculating. :)
can't wait!!
I agree. It should make a certain few scenes involving rain all the more poignant.
comments.subject: Fitting

comments.article:
Oh... It rhymes with Reek.

Btw, quite sad the rain is gone... maybe I'm mistaken but some of the events I imagined being featured in this episode had to be under a heavy rain (not to spoil anything, I'll just say I was thinking of Queescrown and the march of some army...).

Those events wouldnt be the same without the rain, so I hope that if there is no rain in your episode, those events wont be featured in it too...

Then, I know how difficult it is to shoot under heavy rain (natural or artificial), so I'll forgive the show if those events are under the sun.
I was thinking of the same events. But the new title makes me rethink (although it CAN still apply)
comments.subject: Plot

comments.article: Is the title of Autumn Storms under trademark, copyright etc?? I do like the sounds of it (maybe not for Game of Thrones..) and I'd like to use it for something, if legally allowed to.
You cannot copyright titles.

comments.upictitle: { Calypso } - Hear me roar: girl with a book
comments.article: It sounds awesome, I can't wait!

Now that we're getting closer to the HBO GoT 3rd season to come, I started ADWD. I wanted to wait to the last minute....LOVING it and so can't wait till March 31st!! My hearts a flutter!!

XOXOXO

Either title seemed poetic to me..but "i know nothing"
comments.subject: SO Excited!!!

comments.article: I really hope it is not "The Rains of Castamere" at a certain wedding that went away :(

RW... not probable. George had said it was difficult to write that in aSoS so maybe he wouldn't want to go all over again, specially the way a TV script should depict certain things.
Also 7th episode is too early, IMHO it must happen on the 8th or 9th. Still maybe I'm wrong, originally I thought of the former inn, Queenscrown, but now I don't have a clue.
comments.subject: Not probable

comments.article: hey george. we can help thinking about all the chains we've read about in book 3 and imagine stuff. ~~<3
I would love to hear a version of this song done by Jenn Titus!  Check YouTube for her version of Ralph Stanley's "O' Death".
comments.subject: The Rains of Castamere

comments.article: Can not wait for the new season to start! Thank god the HBO series is so utterly fantastic or I'd be SOL in keeping this ASoIaF addiction at bay ;).

George you're my favourite author of all time and i just hope you keep up the good work. The fact that the Martell's are gonna start whoopin sum ass makes it almost unbearable to wait.. Still id rather wait years for masterpiece than weeks for shite .Keep it up bud.
comments.subject: first ever comment so.be gentle.

comments.article:
Now I'm driving myself crazy trying to figure out what will be happening in this episode that will involve "chains" (literally and metaphorically). :) *goes to look back through book 3*

I CAN'T WAIT FOR SEASON 3, AAAAAAAAHHHHHH.
comments.subject: *exciting!*

comments.article: Think about Patchface's: King's blood, fool's blood.. blah blah.. chains for the guests and chains for the bridegroom
comments.subject: Re: *exciting!*

comments.article: I have heard so many good things about this season, I am actually more excited than I have been in previous years. "Chains"...I will definitely be watching!
comments.subject: The Show

comments.article: Autumn Storms sounds cool to me, not much with Chains. Anyway looking forward for the show!
comments.subject: Autumn Storms sounds cool.

comments.article: Ain't it little bit late for the Blackwater chain, eh ? =D

Curious - the episodes you've written have been late in each season - can I assume this is your choice? If it is up to you, what makes you lean toward later (though not final) episodes?

Looking forward!

Extremely excited for the new season. Still haven't ready DWD as I'm waiting until the season has been released as I'm sure I'll be jonesing after the finale!

Didn't know where else to ask this but when creating Jon Snow, were you at all inspired by or influenced by Faramir of Gondor? Randomly came to me when pondering the characters that they share a lot of similarities. Maybe not directly but to a degree, both men are more in touch with the people then their older brothers, Jon snow is not the heir to winterfell due to his bastardness and Faramir was just holding the thrown waiting for the return of king etc. They go on but I'm sure you can figure it out :)
comments.subject: Stoked! Faramir inspire Jon Snow?
